Author: allbits#5898
Content: Newbie here. Installing komodo manually on debian.  Komodod had crashed twice in a row for me. It stays up for a while and then stops. I'm also running a pirate chain and it's fine. Hasn't stopped. First question. Where do I look to see what's happening to komodod

Author: Pixelised#9067
Content: If for example you're running a Hush3 node, you'd look in "/home/pixelised/.komodo/HUSH3/debug.log". Where "pixelised" is your current logged in user and "HUSH3" is whatever coin or assetchain you are using.

Author: Pixelised#9067
Content: @allbits

Author: zatJUM#9924
Content: Where do you run komodod? If in background it won't be easy, just the logs

Author: zatJUM#9924
Content: If you run it in a screen/tmux, just fire it up

Author: allbits#5898
Content: I'll look at logs. Thanks

Content:
"Error: out of memory. Terminating"

Meanwhile pirate chain soldiers on

Author: allbits#5898
Content: So what's best practice for shutting down the test asset chain permanently

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@allbits if you have shared the chain launch params with anyone, the chain will live on depending on what they do with the params (it's out of your control now)
If only you know the launch params, do:
```bash
./komodo-cli -ac_name=<NAME OF ASSETCHAIN> stop
rm -rf ~/.komodo/<NAME OF ASSETCHAIN> 
```

on all the nodes the chain has been launched. Now the chain is gone permenantly

Author: allbits#5898
Content: Thanks

Author: SergeF#8827
Content: How can i convert my HUSH to HUSH3? When i try send  HUSH to exchange my local wallet say me "incorrect address" and exchange support say that i must to convert my HUSH to HUSH3. How can i do this? Thx.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @SergeF do you have your HUSH address private key? if so, just use restore wallet function of Agama 0.3.6 with that private key

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @dukeleto did HUSH team create any guide on how to migrate their coins from HUSH to HUSH3?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: https://github.com/myhush/hush3#claiming-funds-from-old-hush-wallets

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @SergeF if you need to create a new HUSH3 address, just use the Create new wallet function to create a new address using 24 words passphrase. that will generate an R address which is compatible with HUSH3 , KMD and all other KMD assetchains.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: follow this guide https://support.komodoplatform.com/en/support/solutions/articles/29000024492-create-new-wallet-and-encrypt-seed-spv-

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Thanks @CHMEX

Author: SergeF#8827
Content: @SHossain i need to sell my HUSH i don't need HUSH3 address, but thx

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can't sell HUSH anymore i believe. you need to convert them first to HUSH3

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: do you have your HUSH address private key? if so, just use restore wallet function of Agama 0.3.6 with that private key

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: or, follow the guide that HUSH team created here https://github.com/myhush/hush3#claiming-funds-from-old-hush-wallets

Author: SergeF#8827
Content: @SHossain yes. And i'm ask about it. I try restore. Thx

Content: you can use our paper wallet to get hush/hush3 keys

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what is the exact curl command you are using? please post here along with full komodo.conf content. (edit the user and pass value on both)

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: it seems, you are binding the daemon to use local only `bind=127.0.0.1`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: remove this line or comment it out in the conf file and restart daemon

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: i hope this could be the reason for not allowing any other ip other than 127.0.0.1

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: both

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: also, you may want to comment out `rpcconnect=127.0.0.1`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: not exactly sure if this is causing any issue. dont' think so

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: have you tried any other method or rpc call?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
```
curl --user myrpcuser:myrpcpassword --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:myrpcport/
```

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: something like this

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: check out https://developers.komodoplatform.com if you need help. there are plenty of examples

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: is the daemon running?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: have you opened the port in firewall?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: komodo rpc port is 7771

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: let me test on my end

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @dukeleto any idea why @Deleted User is having issue with curl command from external node?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: he has shared the conf and the actuall command using above

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: oh...ok...if you defined port 8232, then that is the port you need to use

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
try
```
curl --user myrpcuser:myrpcpassword --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:myrpcport/
```

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
use this:
```
rpcuser=username
rpcpassword=password
txindex=1
spentindex=1
addressindex=1
timestampindex=1
server=1
rpcallowip=YOUR LOCAL IP
```

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @Deleted User you need to use `rpcallowip=YOUR LOCAL IP` as @gcharang posted above in your komodo.conf file. by default, it will only work from localhost
